description: Change of use from Retail (Class A1) to Office (Class B1)
decision_conditions: Insufficient information has been provided to demonstrate, on the balance of probability, that the proposed change of use from Retail (Class A1) to Office (Class B1) would fall within the parameters of permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 3, Class JA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Application SiteThe site comprises a semi-detached dwelling.ProposalDemoition of existing garage and erection of single-storey side/rear extensionThis application follows a recently refused application 22/01204/HOU dated 06.06.2022 which was refused for the following reason;1) The proposed single storey side extension due to its lack of set back from the front elevation would result in a loss of symmetry to the adjoining semi-detached property. This proposed side extension would not relate well to the ex siting dwelling, would be overly prominent within the street scene, and would be at odds with the character and appearance of neighbouring properties in the immediate surrounding area. The proposal would conflict with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012This reason for refusal would need to be addressed as part of his application.ConsultationEight neighbouring properties have been notified and no representations have been received.AssessmentThe key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; - The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings; and,- Fire Safety.DesignPolicy D3 of the London Plan 2021 states that development proposals should enhance local context by delivering buildings and spaces that positively respond to local distinctiveness through their layout, orientation, scale, appearance and shape, with due regard to existing and emerging street hierarchy, building types, forms and proportions.Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy 2012 and the guidance in the Council's Residential Design Guide SPD 2013 require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area.Officer Comment:Policy Guidance 35 (Single Storey Side Extensions) states that the following guidance should be followed when designing a single storey rear extension:- The roof of the extension should reflect and relate well to the main house and its roof form, and the height of the roof should never encroach on the sill of windows of the second storey.- The extension should remain proportionate and subordinate to the original house, so that in general, the width of the extension does not exceed 50% of that of the original house.- Side extensions should normally be set-back from the front wall of the original house by at least 500mm.- Features such as doors and windows on the new extension should relate to those on the original house.- Side extensions to semi-detached dwellings should respect the symmetry of the adjoining semi-detached property.The proposed side extension has now been set back from the front wall. Officers note that the proposed flat roof element would not be in compliance with policy guidance 35, however, overall it would be a sympathetic addition to the host property.  It is therefore considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.Neighbouring AmenitiesPolicy D3 of the London Plan 2021 states that development proposals should deliver appropriate outlook, privacy and amenity, and should help prevent or mitigate the impacts of noise and poor air quality.Policy DM10 of the Council's Core Strategy also seeks to safeguard the amenities of neighbouring occupiers. To this end, it states that developments should have regard to the amenities of occupants and neighbours, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment:  The principal properties to consider in relation to neighbouring amenity are No. 17 and No. 21 Kneller Road. Due to the location of the proposed development it is unlikely to cause any harm to No. 17 Kneller Road. With regards to No. 21, officer not there are not proposed windows to flank elevation facing towards No. 21. Officers therefore consider that due to its limited height, the proposed development will not cause loss of light or privacy. It is therefore considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.Fire Safety London Plan Policy D12(A) requires all development proposals to achieve the highest standards of fire safety, embedding these at the earliest possible stage.Officer comment: The applicant has not submitted a Fire Safety Strategy, however, the plans include the provision of a suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point and officers see no reason why a development of the type sought could not comply with the rest of the provisions of Policy D12(A), the details of which could be secured through conditions. For these reasons, officers conclude that the proposal would not conflict with Policy D12 of the London Plan.Highways - The proposed development would remove access to the garage area, an area that current provides access to cycle parking. It is therefore reasonable to impose a condition requiring replacement cycle parking to be provided. ConclusionIn conclusion, the proposed development is considered to be in accordance with the development plan taken as a whole and there are no other material considerations which warrant a decision other than in accordance with the development plan.
For the avoidance of doubt, please confirm the description 'Erection of a single storey wrap around side and rear extension.'
